intro: Odontella kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro diatom, is a unicellular marine algae belonging to the phylum Bacillariophyta. It is characterized by its intricate silica cell walls, which form distinctive frustules with complex geometric patterns. This species is typically found in coastal and brackish water environments, where it plays a role in nutrient cycling. Odontella kilimandscharica is also notable for its ability to form dense blooms under certain environmental conditions. Its microscopic structure makes it an important indicator species for water quality assessment.
